ratings.comment: Professor Nelson is the best Professor I have had at UW Madison. She is extremely intelligent and her lectures are interesting. She cares about her students and makes her expectations very clear about what she expects of us. My guess is 90% of the class got an A, it really was not hard to do well in this class.

I found this class very interesting and the workload wasn't bad. You have a lot of time to complete the bigger assignments (there are only a few) and you can easily get by skimming the readings or looking up summaries. Prof. Nelson's lectures are great and she is more than happy to discuss anything course-related with you, virtually or in-person.

my least favorite class. nelson is really smart but doesn't know how to teach students. the class took up way too much time and effort for a 100-level, and it was a lot of reading. just a headache to sit through every time. TA was great and really helpful, and you'll prob get a good grade as long as you attend, but I don't recommend taking it.

Not only where lectures boring but they had absolutely zero correlation with what we are doing for homework. Attendance in this class is absolutely ridiculous, 3 absences out of the 40 classes in a semester will lower your grade by 15%.

Professor Nelson's lectures were always very interesting and by far the most engaging aspect of the class. Frustratingly, however, the actual papers assigned in this class were largely unrelated to the lectures and the grading criteria was incredibly vague. (also note that screens are banned from lectures and that attendance is mandatory & graded)

She reminds me of a middle school teacher, I had to request my rights of privacy not be violated as she attempted to call me out in front of the class for an issue I had a disability accommodation too. Other than that no quizzes/tests, and basic homework. One real essay and one video pitch. Worth it if you can advocate for yourself.
no screens allowed in class even to take notes with. missing 3 lectures out of like 40 makes you automatically lose 15% on your final grade which is ridiculous.
just run. while her course is easy, she's probably the worst professor I've ever had.

She has a a "no electronic policy", and while I was confused at first, I finally got around to it.
Her lectures is like a lullaby, every students I see use this class as afternoon nap chances.
I swear if this class was not attendance graded, no one'd come to this class.

Was not hard but the grading policy is unclear. She says you should end with an A if you do the work. She can be rude if you don't understand or miss a lecture. I don't know my grade yet but I would not say the class was hard but I would not take her again.

easy humanities class if you can put up with professor nelson. She is passionate and kind but sometimes rude. Constantly belittles non arthist majors. Ridiculous no computer policy for notes. Constant canvas announcements written like she is writing to elementary schoolers. Basically forces you to pay attention and makes it her problem if you dont

Prof. Nelson is the best professor I've had at UW Madison. She was the determining force in me declaring my major as Art History. She encourages thoughtful discussion but uses lecture time wisely. Everything she says is brilliant but I also felt very open to share my own thoughts. She gave the best feedback of anyone I've ever spoken to in my life.
